title: 938 New York City Classrooms Tested Positive For Lead Paint
summary: Principals will notify thousands of parents of young children that paint tested positive for lead this summer. New York City principals will notify thousands of parents of young children that their classrooms had cracked, chipped or peeling paint that tested positive for lead this summer, city officials said Thursday.

title: More Gabbard, Delaney and Williamson, Please
summary: And it's past time for Beto O'Rourke, Bill de Blasio and Kirsten Gillibrand to get off the stage.. A few points on round two of the Democratic debates in Detroit. The first night was good, full of fight and clarifying. The second was sour, with candidates jumping around with their small strategies.

title: Lions Gate, Spyglass Media, Viacom Are Leading Contenders to Buy Stake in Miramax
summary: Current owner BeIN is seeking to sell as much as 50% of studio in deal that would value Miramax at up to $650 million. The process to sell a piece of Miramax may be reaching its final act.

title: Kamala's Medicare-for-All Straddle
summary: If you like your private health plan, she wouldn't let you keep it.. Even liberals say Kamala Harris had a bad second debate Wednesday as she struggled to defend her record as a prosecutor and her new health-care plan. The latter is especially revealing about the Democratic debate on health care and is worth explaining in more detail.

title: The China Tariff Ratchet
summary: Trump escalates his coercive trade showdown with China.. One problem with President Trump's China trade strategy of gradually escalating tariffs is that no one knows when or whether they'll stop. Mr. Trump's tariff ratchet is now 18 months old, and on Thursday he escalated again with a 10% levy on $300 billion of additional Chinese imports to begin September 1.

title: Stocks, Bond Yields, Oil Fall on New China Tariffs
summary: Dow industrials erase 300-point gain; oil dives 7.9% for worst day since 2015. Investors reined in longstanding wagers that the U.S. economy will continue outpacing the rest of the world, sending oil to its worst day in nearly 4½ years and dragging down stocks and bond yields.

title: Trump Threatens New Chinese Tariffs
summary: Levies would extend to nearly all Chinese imports, potentially affecting American consumers. WASHINGTON-President Trump moved Thursday to extend tariffs to essentially all Chinese imports, escalating a trade conflict that is poised to hit U.S. consumers in the pocketbook and roiling financial markets.

title: House Democrats' Missile Mess
summary: They want to block weapons the U.S. needs to deter China.. The 1987 Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty officially passes into the annals of Cold War history on Friday, dumped by the Trump Administration after more than a decade of Russian violations. Congressional arms-controllers can't revive the treaty, but they are aiming to deny the U.S. any defense advantages from its demise.

title: Fed Examined Amazon's Cloud in New Scrutiny for Tech
summary: Visit was made in April to Amazon facility in Virginia. The Federal Reserve conducted a formal examination this spring of an Amazon.com Inc. facility in Virginia, the first of what is expected to be ongoing oversight of giant cloud providers that have become repositories of sensitive banking information, people familiar with the matter said.

title: 'Because Internet' Review: How We Talk Online
summary: The linguistic and typographical oddities of the internet reflect a very human need to communicate ineffable social subtleties.. What do you say on the internet when there's no one to hear you scream? If you're a digital native you might keysmash "asdjkhjf;lfdl;k" or use an unpronounceable emoticon when there are no words to convey quite what you're feeling. But if you're part of the dwindling population of people for whom internet life remains alien, such weird, wordless linguistic innovations might render you speechless and possibly a little panicked.

title: Socialism Won't Win in Brooklyn, Iowa
summary: If Obama is too far right for Democrats, they're too far left for swing voters.. The Democrats at times reprise the argument my parents used to have during long car rides: "Turn left." "No, make a right." If my party makes the wrong turn, we'll end up in an electoral ditch in 2020.

title: The Left vs. the Crazy Left
summary: If you're looking for a moderate president, you won't find one in the Democratic field.. The nation has struggled to categorize the Democratic presidential candidates. Sen. Elizabeth Warren is some days a "populist," others a "liberal." Sen. Bernie Sanders is at pains to define "democratic socialism" as apart from plain, old "socialism." The media describes Sen. Amy Klobuchar as a "centrist" or "moderate," even as she insists on "proven progressive."

title: Joshua Harris Kisses Christianity Goodbye
summary: Don't give up praying for the disillusioned leader of the 1990s Purity Movement.. Not all those who wander are lost, J.R.R. Tolkien observed. The corollary is that not all who lead know where they're going. Both these statements are true of Joshua Harris, the former pastor and author of "I Kissed Dating Goodbye" (1997), who acknowledged on Instagram last week that "by all the measurements that I have for defining a Christian, I am not a Christian."

title: Trial Begins for Proud Boys Members Accused of Attacking Protesters
summary: Two men are accused of inciting a riot following a speech by the far-right organization's founder. Two members of the far-right group Proud Boys went on trial Thursday, accused of inciting a brawl after a 2018 speech by the organization's founder at a New York City Republican club.

title: Former Brixmor Property Executives Charged With Accounting Fraud
summary: Prosecutors and SEC say Brixmor's former CEO and CFO manipulated numbers to deceive investors about company's performance. WASHINGTON-The former chief executive officer of shopping-center owner Brixmor Property Group Inc. and his finance chief were charged with accounting fraud for allegedly manipulating a widely used metric of profitability.

title: You Can't Blame Trump for Baltimore's Failure
summary: Ineffective and dishonest politicians have used racism as a shield from criticism for half a century.. To make sense of President Trump's dust-up with Rep. Elijah Cummings, Speaker Nancy Pelosi and the rest of the Democratic Party, you have to go back to Baltimore in April 1968, when the city was overwhelmed by a riot in the wake of Martin Luther King Jr.'s assassination. The National Guard and city police proved unable to contain the situation. Mayor Tommy D'Alesandro III, Mrs. Pelosi's elder brother, pleaded with President Lyndon B. Johnson to send in federal troops.

title: Republican Engineer Fired by Google Claims 'Bullying'
summary: Search giant's culture wars flame anew; a senior executive contacts law enforcement over leaks. MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif.-Kevin Cernekee was still a "Noogler"-Google's term for a new employee-when his conservative take on political and social issues raised hackles within the search giant.

title: Israeli Jets Appear to Have Struck Iraq for the First Time Since 1981
summary: No nation has yet claimed the July air raids against two bases of a Shiite militia backed by Iran.. Two airstrikes on Shiite militia targets took place in Iraq last month. No country or organization has taken responsibility, but there are strong reasons to think they were carried out by Israel. If so, these would be the Jewish state's first air raids on Iraq since the destruction of Saddam Hussein's Osirak nuclear reactor in 1981.

title: Maybe We're All Gold Bugs Now
summary: Standard monetary wisdom on exchange rates doesn't quite work in the increasingly global system.. Who knew exchange rates could be so exciting? After a spell out of the public eye, here they come roaring back to wreak political havoc around the world.

summary: Congress passes legislation that extends lifeline to financially struggling veterans. title: Generic Drugmaker Lannett Hires CFO Amid Industry Headwinds
summary: Longtime finance chief of Philadelphia-based company to retire in August. Lannett Co. 's new finance chief joins at a time when the Philadelphia-based distributor of generic drugs for conditions such as congestive heart failure and gastrointestinal disease is facing legal challenges and industry headwinds.

title: U.S. Allies Criticize Sanctions Imposed on Iran's Top Diplomat
summary: European Union officials vow to continue meetings with Foreign Minister Javad Zarif in an effort to preserve 2015 nuclear accord. U.S. allies criticized Washington's decision to impose sanctions on Iran's foreign minister and vowed to keep their own diplomatic channels open, in the latest spat between the White House and European countries over how to deal with Tehran.

title: Supreme Court Justices Are Exempt From Ethics Review, Panel Finds
summary: Judicial-conduct committee dismisses complaints lodged against Justice Brett Kavanaugh. WASHINGTON-A judicial-conduct panel on Thursday dismissed ethics complaints filed against Justice Brett Kavanaugh over his behavior at confirmation hearings, concluding that members of the Supreme Court were exempt from review.

title: Puerto Rico Gubernatorial Nominee Stalls in Legislature
summary: Island territory's leadership crisis expected to continue past Friday, when Ricardo Rosselló plans to leave. Puerto Rico's Senate delayed a confirmation vote on the nominee to succeed Gov. Ricardo Rosselló until after his planned exit, likely extending the island territory's leadership crisis into next week.

summary: Maker of survey software hires Eric Johnson from Talend to oversee IT and drive strategy. summary: Total, Royal Dutch Shell and Equinor reported results that missed expectations. Royal Dutch Shell PLC's profit plunged in the second quarter, with lower oil and gas prices and weaker refining margins outweighing a rise in production.

title: FTC Antitrust Probe of Facebook Scrutinizes Its Acquisitions
summary: Regulators examining whether social-media giant bought companies to neutralize possible rivals. The Federal Trade Commission is examining Facebook Inc. 's acquisitions as part of its antitrust investigation into the social-media giant, seeking to determine if they were part of a campaign to snap up potential rivals to head off competitive threats, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Comey Won't Be Prosecuted Over Release of Classified Information
summary: Ex-FBI chief says he hoped memos would trigger appointment of special prosecutor. WASHINGTON-The Justice Department won't prosecute former FBI Director James Comey over his dissemination of memos detailing his encounters with President Trump which contained classified information, a person familiar with the matter said Thursday.

title: U.S., Japan Edge Closer to Limited Trade Pact
summary: Accord would give Trump a modest win amid diminished expectations for a landmark deal with China. WASHINGTON-The U.S. and Japan are working to hammer out a limited trade pact that would pave the way for more U.S. farm exports to Japan, while dropping the threat of U.S. tariffs on Japanese cars.

title: U.S. Details Plan to Rebuild Venezuela Under Democratic Rule
summary: Washington is ready to bring aid and investment once Maduro is gone, says Commerce Secretary Ross. BRASÍLIA-U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross laid out a plan including credit and investment to help rebuild Venezuela's economy under democratic rule, as Washington pushes for new leadership in the struggling nation.

title: Defense Secretary Esper to Review JEDI Cloud Contract
summary: Amazon, Microsoft were finalists for contract valued at up to $10 billion. WASHINGTON-Defense Secretary Mark Esper will undertake a review of a massive cloud-computing contract before the Pentagon awards it, creating a new potential obstacle for the lucrative deal that had been questioned by President Trump.

title: Lowe's Lays Off Thousands of Store Workers
summary: Home-improvement chain will outsource maintenance, assembly jobs as retailers scrutinize labor costs. Lowe's Cos. told thousands of store workers this week their jobs were being eliminated as the company outsourced tasks such as assembling barbecue grills and janitorial services.

title: Staten Island Has a Deer Problem. How About a Bow Hunt?
summary: The deer population has exploded over the past decade, as the leafy borough has become an ideal habitat for the animals. During the past three years, New York City has made some headway controlling the deer population on Staten Island through a vasectomy program. But some borough residents and politicians say the surest way to reduce the population is to declare a bow hunt.

title: Syrians Illegally in U.S. Get Reprieve From Trump Administration
summary: U.S. extends program permitting them to stay through March 2021. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration is extending a program protecting Syrians illegally in the U.S. from deportation because of their home country's civil war. The reprieve comes as the White House presses efforts to restrict immigration on other fronts.

summary: U.S. Treasury Department will auction next week $123 billion in new debt and $39 billion in previously sold debt. title: Texas Joins Fight to Block T-Mobile-Sprint Merger

title: Bank Stocks Decline After Trump's New Tariff Threat
summary: Economic concern pushes down shares of Citigroup and JPMorgan as well as regional lenders. Bank stocks fell sharply Thursday after President Trump's latest tariff threat sent U.S. Treasury yields tumbling and raised new questions about the outlook for economic growth.

title: EBay Sues Amazon Workers on Seller-Poaching Claims
summary: E-commerce company says new lawsuit followed talks with alleged whistleblower despite continuing arbitration. title: Trucks Shield Detroit Auto Makers From Global Headwinds
summary: Big pickups give car makers a vital profit lifeline as pressures build in the U.S. and abroad. Sales of big pickup trucks to American buyers are helping Detroit's car companies counter a sputtering global auto market.

title: The Man Who Devised the Formula to Find NFL Stars
summary: Dallas Cowboys executive Gil Brandt will join the Hall of Fame this weekend after a career revolutionizing scouting. He also laid the foundation for analytics.. OXNARD, Calif.-Minutes turned to hours during the 1964 NFL draft, with the Cowboys set to pick but steadfastly refusing to send in a name. There wasn't a pick clock in those days, and Vince Lombardi eventually marched over to excoriate Gil Brandt and the Dallas executives who were wasting everyone else's time.

title: Treasury Yield Hits Lowest Level Since 2016 Vote
summary: Weak economic data and decline in oil prices also raise concerns on global growth outlook and Fed's ability to stimulate inflation. The yield on the 10-year U.S. Treasury note recorded its largest one-day decline in more than a year, falling to its lowest level since the 2016 presidential election after President Trump announced new tariffs on Chinese imports.

title: Smart-Lock Startup Latch Opens Door to New Funding
summary: New York company, now valued at about $400 million, sells smart-lock systems to apartment building managers. title: Fitbit Shares Hit as Smartwatch Market Gets Crowded
summary: FitBit's smartwatch business is running low on power in the battle for arm space with rivals Apple and Samsung. Fitbit 's smartwatch business is running low on power in the battle for arm space with rivals Apple Inc. and Samsung Electronics Co.

title: The Rookie Manager Who Is Really Good at Getting Thrown Out of Games
summary: Reds skipper David Bell has already been ejected eight times this season. That's 7.5% of all the games in his managerial career thus far.. Major League Baseball on Thursday suspended six players for an ugly bench-clearing brawl between the Cincinnati Reds and Pittsburgh Pirates on Tuesday night. Pirates pitcher Keone Kela got 10 games for throwing a pitch around the head of Derek Dietrich. Reds reliever Amir Garrett received eight games for inciting the fight by charging the Pittsburgh dugout. Yasiel Puig got three games even though he doesn't play for the Reds anymore--he was traded from Cincinnati to Cleveland during Tuesday's game.

title: Fed Pick Shelton Says Other Countries Are 'Cheating' by Devaluing Currencies
summary: Shelton likens current situation to 'beggar thy neighbor' economic policies of the 1930s. WASHINGTON-One of President Trump's latest picks for the Federal Reserve Board, conservative economic commentator Judy Shelton, said foreign countries are devaluing their currencies to prop up their economies.

title: North Korean Weapons Tests Sharpen Abilities to Fend Off a U.S.-Led Attack
summary: Mild U.S. reaction has created a diplomatic buffer, military experts say, for the North to hone weapons that would typically draw blowback from the U.N.. SEOUL-North Korea's recent weapons tests are widely seen as a means to pressure the U.S. into offering concessions when talks resume, including easing economic sanctions and relaxing demands that Pyongyang relinquish its nuclear weapons.

title: Street Fight: Vendors Square Off Against Nonprofit Developer Over Valuable Curb Space
summary: Resume Subscription. The east side of a Broadway block in Midtown Manhattan, steps away from Macy's flagship store, has become a battlefield in recent months between street vendors and an office tower under renovation.

title: Snacks Drive Gains at Kellogg, Offsetting Weaker Cereal Sales
summary: Overall, quarterly revenue at the food maker rose to $3.46 billion from $3.36 billion a year earlier. Consumer appetite for snacks drove Kellogg Co. 's results in the second quarter, helping the food maker offset weaker demand for cereals in the U.S. and Canada.

title: Overstock Is in the Red, but Its Shares Are Soaring
summary: Among U.S. stocks, Overstock.com has recorded one of the largest gains over the past two months. Overstock.com Inc. shares have more than doubled over the past two months, one of the best gainers among U.S. stocks, even as the company struggles to turn around its retail business and find profits in its blockchain division.

title: 'Luce': Psyching Out an Enigma
summary: Adapted from a stage play, Julius Onah's new film finds mystery and possibly malice in a high school's model black student.. Instead of calling the high-school student at the center of "Luce" a poster boy, let's call him a paragon. Poster boys are two-dimensional, since they're on posters. Luce, the adopted black son of a white suburban couple, is multifaceted and full of life, not least because he's played by Kelvin Harrison Jr., an actor who combines seemingly effortless appeal with uncommon skill. A decade ago Luce was a child in an Eritrean war zone, traumatized by violence. Now he's a paragon of scholarship, athleticism, soft-spoken eloquence and personal grace-of everything, the film suggests wryly, his white community would like him to be. Except it could all be an act, a serene façade built up by a tortured spirit-or a sociopath. The narrative, framed as a psychological mystery, labors under more layers of significance than it can handle without falling into contrivance and argumentation. Still, the dramatic core is strong, an exceptional young man struggling to find, and become, whoever he really is.

title: 'Fast & Furious Presents: Hobbs & Shaw': A Robotic Franchise Spinoff
summary: Dwayne Johnson and Jason Statham team up to save the world in this impressively staged and cheerfully nonsensical action blockbuster.. In the overlong title of the overly overlong action thriller "Fast & Furious Presents: Hobbs & Shaw," the word "presents" is as squishy as the word "supports" on the label of a homeopathic remedy.

title: Brooklyn Man Is Arrested for Allegedly Dousing NYPD Traffic Agents
summary: Arrest comes a day after state lawmakers introduced a bill to make spraying water on police a felony. New York City police arrested a suspect Thursday who is accused of dousing two traffic-enforcement agents with water on July 24.

summary: With data from NPD BookScan.

title: 'Progressive': Moving Forward, From 'Bull Moose' to Bernie
summary: Long before the Democratic debate over the term, it was used to describe the movement of planets, and then of Teddy Roosevelt. On Tuesday night, the first of this week's double-barreled Democratic presidential debates was billed as a matchup pitting the party's two fiery progressive standard-bearers, Sens. Elizabeth Warren and Bernie Sanders, against eight moderates.

title: 'Infinity Train' Review: An Endless Ride Through Dreamlike Worlds
summary: The new animated series, which springs from a popular 2016 YouTube short, follows a girl's journey on a train where each car is its own surreal new realm.. You can't use "surreal" or "Kafkaesque" without risking an eye roll, but it's hard to describe "Infinity Train" without resorting to both. Intellectually mischievous, snarky, campy, animated and set in a perversely totalitarian dreamland, "Infinity Train" is about a 13-year-old girl who finds herself aboard a seemingly endless train on which each car contains a separate universe-a hero's journey, Joseph Campbell might say. But the dreadful-looking train also seems like a silent shout-out to "Maus." And the whole thing suggests a film by Luis Buñuel starring Rocky the Flying Squirrel.

title: Going Out of Style: Tax-Driven Deals to Move Corporate HQs Outside U.S.
summary: Mylan took an overseas address in a 2015 deal, but its new form will have a U.S. parent. Inversions are starting to revert.

title: 'The Distant Barking of Dogs' Review: Growing Up Between Bombs
summary: Simon Lereng Wilmont's documentary about a 10-year-old boy and his grandmother in war-torn Ukraine runs in an abbreviated, impressionistic form on PBS.. When "The Distant Barking of Dogs" made the Oscar shortlist for this year's Best Documentary Feature it was 91 minutes long. When it appears on "P.O.V." Monday night, it will clock in at an abbreviated 53 minutes-something of a different film, unavoidably, though one that makes its points potently enough. And which will still leave viewers unsure what they want to scream at the screen-"Don't be afraid!" or "Run for your life!"

title: Trucker Celadon Gets $165 Million in New Financing
summary: A loan included in the package includes rights for an unnamed shareholder to buy a roughly 49.9% stake in the truckload carrier. Trucking company Celadon Group Inc. has received $165 million in new financing that the company said will help its turnaround efforts.

title: Duped by a Robocall From Overseas? It Was Legal
summary: FCC voted on a rule making it illegal for callers abroad to spoof numbers for malicious purposes. It is legal for robocallers overseas to trick U.S. consumers by disguising their phone numbers. The Federal Communications Commission just voted to change that.

summary: The retreat from market driven by e-commerce expansion comes three years after Schneider entered the business with two acquisitions. summary: Retirement columnist Glenn Ruffenach also answers questions on IRAs and Medicare. Some of us try to focus on the positive parts of later life, but some of us get wrapped up in the negatives. Have you talked with retirees about this? How do couples deal with this?

title: Secrets of Superior Salad Architecture
summary: Say goodbye to the big bowl. Instead, compose your ingredients on a platter for a salad à la Frank Lloyd Wright: low slung, well crafted, harmonious. LATELY I HAVE noticed fundamental changes to my salad-making approach. Once all the ingredients are prepped and ready to be put together, more often than not, I reach for a serving platter instead of a salad bowl.

title: A Lighter Take on Grilled Steak
summary: This recipe from chef Caroline Glover of Annette in Aurora, Colo., pairs flank steak with charred romaine and a zesty olive tapenade. She left behind a plum sous-chef position in Manhattan to work on farms and learn just how much effort goes into raising excellent vegetables. Now she's back in the kitchen at her own restaurant, Annette, in Aurora, Colo., still rhapsodizing over the veg.

title: Dead Calm Before the 5G Storm
summary: Qualcomm, Apple and others suffer big smartphone slump ahead of 5G rollout. But will next year really bring relief?. The global smartphone market is taking a significant pause ahead of the rollout of 5G services. The big question is just how long that pause will last.

title: Cate Blanchett Always Passes on Ice. Unless It's an Iceberg.
summary: The 'Where'd You Go, Bernadette' actress and reluctant fashion icon on her fantasy guest list, her most recent binge-watch and her commitment to sunscreen. "The rest of my life is not organized, but my wardrobe is," said the 50-year-old mother of four (from her youngest, Edith, whom Ms. Blanchett and her husband, playwright Andrew Upton, adopted in 2015, to her eldest, Dashiell, 17).

title: National Judicial Injunctions and the Law
summary: Federal courts have the authority to bind only the parties before them, not the entire nation.. Regarding your editorial "The National Injunction Dysfunction" (July 29): Your diagnosis of the national injunctions problem is right, but the prescription should be stronger. I share your hope that courts will voluntarily eschew the practice, but the Framers didn't trust any branch to police itself. The Constitution gives Congress the authority to set the rules for federal courts including available remedies.

title: Child Detainees and Geographical Preference
summary: Border Patrol stations aren't equipped to serve as nurseries, day-care centers or overnight shelters for children.. Neither the Border Patrol nor the Office of Refugee Resettlement is to blame for the number of children remaining in border stations longer than 72 hours ("Agencies Spar on Child Detentions," U.S. News, July 13). The federal systems of care for unaccompanied children are simply overwhelmed by the tens of thousands of children who have been entering this country every year since 2012. Border Patrol stations aren't equipped to serve as nurseries, day-care centers or overnight shelters for children. When I served as deputy director for children's services at the Department of Health and Human Services' Office of Refugee Resettlement, I met Border Patrol officers who used their own resources to buy supplies and food for children at their stations.

title: Manager Accused of Squelching Abuse Report at U.S. Indian Health Service Center Quits
summary: Subordinates said Tracey Grant ordered them not to report allegation of child sexual abuse at Unity Healing Center in North Carolina. title: Libraries Need Access to E-Books for Patrons
summary: Public libraries promote authors and their readership. Neither writers nor readers will benefit from this practice to limit availability to e-books to library patrons.. Libraries have promoted e-book usage over the past 15 years, investing in the market long before the public was familiar with it.

title: BOE Chief Warns Messy Brexit Would Pressure Global Economy

LONDON-An abrupt and messy split between the U.K. and the European Union would heap further pressure on a global economy beset by slowing growth and tensions over trade, said the U.K.'s central bank chief, in a rare warning on the potential effects of Brexit beyond Britain's shores.

title: Senate Passes Two-Year Spending Deal That Suspends Debt Ceiling
summary: President Trump is expected to sign the bill, pushing most contentious budget debates until after 2020 election. WASHINGTON-A two-year agreement to raise federal spending and at the same time lift the government's borrowing limit will go to the president's desk after it passed the Senate with more Democrats voting for it than Republicans.

title: Our Favorite Summer Wines: Semisparkling, Entirely Delightful
summary: It's the season for drinking something fun, and semi-sparkling wines certainly fit the bill. Our wine columnist shares her gently-bubbly summer go-to's. EVERYTHING SLOWS down during the summer, including my consumption of serious wine. For me, summer is for wines that are lighthearted and fun-and, often, halfway between sparkling and still. Technically referred to as semisparkling, these wines might be better described as frolicsome.

title: The Fasting Cure Is No Fad
summary: New research is showing the profound benefits-for weight, longevity and fighting disease-of eating only during limited hours. Fasting is one of the biggest weight-loss trends to arise in recent years. Endorsed by A-list celebrities and the subject of a spate of best-selling books, it was the eighth most-Googled diet in America in 2018.

title: Detroit Is Hooked on Trucks
summary: When the fever for bigger, more expensive vehicles fades, U.S. auto giants will have nowhere to hide. Investors worry when market rallies depend on the performance of just a few star stocks. Something similar is going on in the global car industry, where profit growth now depends on a perilously narrow story of U.S. light-truck sales.

title: Windowless Hotel Rooms: Cozy or Claustrophobic?
summary: Hotel accommodations without windows are trending, but who's actually booking them?. THE STANDARD HOTEL opened in London's King Cross a few weeks ago with all of the brand's attendant style and swagger. The 266 guest quarters, occupying a converted brutalist-style 1970s government building, are appointed with Bang & Olufsen speakers and Craig Green-designed robes. Many come with sofas custom-built to fit rounded alcoves. The hotel also offers 28 "Cosy Core" rooms, which, for all their coziness, lack one amenity most travelers view as essential as a bed: windows.

title: Gas Pipeline Explosion in Kentucky Kills at Least One
summary: The over-9,000-mile-long pipeline ruptured in a rural part of the state. A natural-gas pipeline in Kentucky ruptured and exploded early Thursday, causing the death of at least one person and injuring five others, emergency authorities said.

summary: Yum Brands has never been as richly valued, but its growth and cash flow are enough to keep the stock rising. Even at record prices, Yum Brands shares aren't cooling off.

summary: Attack marks a setback for U.N.-backed efforts to bring the Yemeni conflict to an end. Yemen's Houthi rebels killed at least 36 people in a missile-and-drone attack Thursday on a government-controlled southern port city, the latest blow to already faltering United Nations-backed efforts to end a four-year war.

summary: Wages stalled but costs haven't, so people increasingly rent or finance what their parents might have owned outright. The American middle class is falling deeper into debt to maintain a middle-class lifestyle.

title: Inside the Moneyed Montauk Enclave Where Time Stands Still
summary: Resume Subscription. Down a single-lane pebbled road near the tip of the Long Island peninsula-largely invisible to traffic, unknown to most visitors-a historic collection of wood-shingled homes hearkens to the Hamptons of more than a century ago. It was a time before air-conditioning and infinity pools, when herds of cattle and sheep roamed Montauk's ranches.

title: Music to Apple's Ears
summary: Newly updated AirPods amped up non-iPhone business. Apple Inc.'s AirPods met with no small amount of derision when they first hit the market three years ago, with reviewers and critics competing to conjure the most colorful comparison for the wireless buds. Q-Tips, bent cigarettes and tampons were among the favorites.

title: The Lobster's Coat of Many Colors
summary: The crustacean's dingy brown shell conceals brilliant blue and red pigments within.. At this time of year, I often catch myself remembering past summers. I lived in New England for two years, and the summers surfed in on a giant wave of enthusiasm for eating crabs and lobsters. I don't eat seafood, but I'm happy to spectate, especially at a lobster restaurant. Watching people happily poking about inside these giant crustaceans, laying bare their fabulously weird anatomy while dodging the odd squirt of liquid, was unexpectedly joyful.

title: The Retro-Future Planet of Pierre Cardin

title: A Palace Open to the People
summary: From the Pharaohs to Queen Victoria, royal dwellings have been symbols of how rulers think about power.. Every summer, Queen Elizabeth II opens the state rooms of Buckingham Palace to the public. This year's opening features an exhibition that I curated, "Queen Victoria's Palace," the result of a three-year collaboration with Royal Collection Trust. The exhibition uses paintings, objects and even computer-generated imagery to show how Victoria transformed Buckingham Palace into both a family home and the headquarters of the monarchy. In the process, she modernized not only the building itself but also the relationship between the Royal Family and the British people.

summary: Statistics on wages among numbers that will measure expansion's resiliency. title: Five Things I Wish I Had Known Before I Built My House
summary: The home-building process takes longer and costs more than you may think. Construction on our new house was about half done when the plumber went out for nearly two weeks because a cut on his finger was badly infected. That held up the electricians, who needed to run wire for all the lights, outlets and switches. That delayed the Sheetrock installation, which delayed the painters. The shell of the house stood empty. I was tempted to drive to the plumber's house to personally flush his hand wound and administer antibiotics.

title: Michael Kittredge, Founder of Yankee Candle, Lived Large While He Could
summary: Massachusetts entrepreneur entertained lavishly and spent more than $20,000 on a bottle of wine. By his own admission, the first candle Michael J. Kittredge II made was a mess.
